revised_title: The Influence of Entrapped Gas on the Initiation of Explosions in Liquids and Solids
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand how trapped gas influences the initiation of explosions in liquids and solids. They discovered that the sensitivity of an explosive is highly dependent on the pressure ratio and that the adiabatic compression and heating of trapped gas during impact is responsible for initiating explosions. The study also found that the nature of the included gas plays a crucial role in the explosion efficiency.
